title: Technical SEO - MozMoz logoMenu openMenu closeSearchMoz logo
description: Your all-in-one suite of SEO essentials.
content: By: Lindsay Kolowich November 16, 2017 How & Why to Make Your Website More Secure Search Engines | Technical SEO Last month, Google stepped up their game when it comes to holding sites to security standards. If you're not sure whether your site's security levels make the cut or need tips on how to get started, this primer will help. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers November 7, 2017 How to Do a Keyword-Driven Content Audit (with Keyword Explorer) Technical SEO | Moz Tools | Keyword Research How do you find the hidden gems in your outdated content? Dr. Pete walks through a step-by-step process to find your highest potential content using keywords it already ranks on. Includes bonus Google Sheet. Read this post By: Alexis Sanders October 18, 2017 Unlocking Hidden Gems Within Schema.org Technical SEO | Advanced SEO Schema.org can be a confusing resource if you're trying to learn how to use and implement structured data. This mini-guide arms you with the right kind of thinking to tackle your next structured data project. Read this post By: Bartosz Góralewicz October 16, 2017 Google Shares Details About the Technology Behind Googlebot Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO It's been revealed that version 41 of the Google Chrome browser is the technology behind Google's crawler. What does this mean for developers, and how can you use this in your own SEO toolkit? Read this post By: Bartosz Góralewicz October 16, 2017 Does Googlebot Support HTTP/2? Challenging Google's Indexing Claims – An Experiment Technical SEO | Search Engines | Advanced SEO Googlebot can't crawl or index sites using HTTP/2 alone. Based on the results of this experiment, you may want to continue optimizing for HTTP/1.1 as well. Read this post By: Jo Cameron October 10, 2017 How to Turn Low-Value Content Into Neatly Organized Opportunities - Next Level Technical SEO | Content Marketing Low-quality site content results in unhappy visitors and potentially even Google penalties. You can identify thin, duplicate, or spam-like content using a tool like Site Crawl. Read this post By: Robin Lord September 20, 2017 So You Want to Build a Chat Bot – Here's How (Complete with Code!) SEO Tools | Technical SEO Anyone can build a helpful, functioning chat bot, even if you're not a coder. Robin Lord shares an insightful how-to, complete with lessons learned and free code via GitHub to fast-track your own bot's production. Read this post By: JR Ridley September 13, 2017 Pros and Cons of HTTPS Services: Traditional vs Let's Encrypt vs Cloudflare Technical SEO | SEO Tools Thinking about going secure? It's more important than ever, with Google issuing security warnings for many non-secure sites in Chrome. This comparison of three popular HTTPS services will help you determine the best option for implementing an SSL certification on your site. Read this post By: Bridget Randolph September 11, 2017 The Beginner’s Guide to Structured Data for SEO: How to Implement It SEO Basics | Technical SEO Learn to identify opportunities and implement structured data for SEO on your website. This guide focuses on the most basic types of markup and the most common use cases, plus resources to help with the more technical aspects of implementation. Read this post By: Bridget Randolph September 6, 2017 The Beginner's Guide to Structured Data for SEO: A Two-Part Series SEO Basics | Technical SEO SEOs have been talking about structured data for a few years now, but only 17% of marketers are using it. There's still a lot of confusion around what structured data is, what it’s for, and how and when to implement structured data for SEO purposes. Read this post By: Alexis Sanders June 20, 2017 JavaScript & SEO: Making Your Bot Experience As Good As Your User Experience Technical SEO | Advanced SEO More and more, we're realizing it's incredibly important for us as SEOs to understand JavaScript's impact on search experience. Can search engines see your content and experience your site the way a user does? If not, what solutions can you use to fix it? Read this post By: Rand Fishkin June 9, 2017 How Does Google Handle CSS + Javascript "Hidden" Text? Advanced SEO | Technical SEO | Whiteboard Friday Does Google treat text kept behind "read more" links with the same importance as non-hidden text? The short answer is "no," but there's more nuance to it than that. In today's Whiteboard Friday, Rand explains just how the search engine giant weighs text hidden from view using CSS and JavaScript. Read this post By: Dr. Peter J. Meyers June 8, 2017 Site Crawl, Day 1: Where Do You Start? Technical SEO | Advanced SEO When you're faced with thousands of technical SEO issues, knowing where to start can be vital. Powered by Moz's new Site Crawl, I guide you through the process of isolating critical issues quickly. Read this post By: JR Ridley May 31, 2017 Optimizing AngularJS Single-Page Applications for Googlebot Crawlers Technical SEO | Advanced SEO SEO for single-page application websites can be tricky: they're great for users, but potentially invisible to Google's crawlers. Learn what steps you can take to ensure your SPAs are found and indexed. Read this post
